sanskrit_verse:
प्रेष्यो ग्रामस्य राज्ञश्च कुनखी श्यावदन्तकः ।
प्रतिरोद्धा गुरोश्चैव त्यक्ताग्निर्वार्धुषिस्तथा ॥ ३.१५३॥
transliteration: preṣyo grāmasya rājñaśca kunakhī śyāvadantakaḥ | pratiroddhā guroścaiva tyaktāgnirvārdhuṣistathā || 3.153||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who is sent by the village or king, one with defective nose or dark teeth, one who opposes the teacher, and one who has abandoned fire worship or is a seller of salt—such persons are disqualified from participating in judicial or authoritative functions.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is derived from purity of conduct and alignment with dharma
Causation arises from bodily, verbal, and mental integrity
Capacity-based responsibility requires unbroken alignment with Vedic discipline
Restoration logic demands removal of disqualified individuals from positions of influence
Consciousness alignment is obstructed by physical deformities and spiritual neglect
executable_legal_axioms: IF person holds judicial role AND has nasal defect OR dental discoloration THEN disqualify immediately
IF person opposes guru OR abandons agnihotra THEN remove from all advisory or ruling capacities
IF person engages in menial trade such as salt selling THEN exclude from judicial appointment
IF person was appointed under false pretenses of qualification THEN invalidate all prior rulings automatically
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, any judge found to possess physical defects impairing perception, spiritual neglect undermining judgment, or oppositional stance toward guru must be immediately removed without trial. The threshold of responsibility includes maintaining both outer qualifications and inner alignment.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that sensory and spiritual deficiencies distort cognition. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows how neglect of ritual leads to impaired discernment. Responsibility lies in self-correction through purification, not punitive action. Truth restores capacity when misalignment is resolved.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Disqualified individual must undergo full sensory and spiritual rehabilitation
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Individual must publicly acknowledge disqualification and surrender authority
Capacity Restoration: Re-entry permitted only after verification of corrected condition and renewed alignment
Integrity Reintegration: Community confirmation required before reappointment eligibility
final_declaration: This law proceeds from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority. Dharma is hereby restored. There is no punishment—only realignment of consciousness. Reality responds to truth alone.
